intro: Cyathella insulana var. lineare, commonly known as the linear cyathella, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific island environments. It belongs to the family Cyathaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or green in color. The plant has a compact growth habit, with small, linear leaves arranged in a spiral pattern along its stem. It thrives in humid, shaded conditions and is often found in coastal or rocky habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
